segment.source: Preparing Your Environment for UE-V
segment.target: Preparing Your Environment for UE-V

segment.source: Preparing Your Environment for UE-V
segment.target: Preparing Your Environment for UE-V

segment.source: Preparing Your Environment for UE-V
segment.target: Preparing Your Environment for UE-V

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) roams settings between computers by the use of a settings storage location.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) roams settings between computers by the use of a settings storage location.

segment.source: The settings storage location is a file share and should be configured during the UE-V Agent deployment.
segment.target: The settings storage location is a file share and should be configured during the UE-V Agent deployment.

segment.source: It must be defined either as a settings storage location or as an Active Directory home directory.
segment.target: It must be defined either as a settings storage location or as an Active Directory home directory.

segment.source: In addition, the administrator should configure a time server to support consistent synchronization.
segment.target: In addition, the administrator should configure a time server to support consistent synchronization.

segment.source: To prepare your environment for UE-V, you should consider the following:
segment.target: To prepare your environment for UE-V, you should consider the following:

segment.source: UE-V Settings Storage:
segment.target: UE-V Settings Storage:

segment.source: Defining a Settings Storage Location
segment.target: Defining a Settings Storage Location

segment.source: Using Active Directory Home Directory with UE-V
segment.target: Using Active Directory Home Directory with UE-V

segment.source: Synchronize Computer Clocks for UE-V Settings Synchronization
segment.target: Synchronize Computer Clocks for UE-V Settings Synchronization

segment.source: Performance and Capacity Planning
segment.target: Performance and Capacity Planning

segment.source: For more information about operating system and computer requirements, see Supported Configurations for UE-V 1.0.
segment.target: For more information about operating system and computer requirements, see Supported Configurations for UE-V 1.0.

segment.source: UE-V settings storage
segment.target: UE-V settings storage

segment.source: You can define the User Experience Virtualization settings storage in one of two configurations: a settings storage location or an Active Directory home directory.
segment.target: You can define the User Experience Virtualization settings storage in one of two configurations: a settings storage location or an Active Directory home directory.

segment.source: Define a settings storage location
segment.target: Define a settings storage location

segment.source: The UE-V settings storage location is a standard network share that is accessible by UE-V users.
segment.target: The UE-V settings storage location is a standard network share that is accessible by UE-V users.

segment.source: Before you define the settings storage location, you must create a root directory.
segment.target: Before you define the settings storage location, you must create a root directory.

segment.source: Users who will store settings on the share must have read/write permissions to the storage location.
segment.target: Users who will store settings on the share must have read/write permissions to the storage location.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent will create user-specific folders under this root directory.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent will create user-specific folders under this root directory.

segment.source: The settings storage location is defined by setting the SettingsStoragePath configuration option.
segment.target: The settings storage location is defined by setting the SettingsStoragePath configuration option.

segment.source: This option can be configured in the following ways:
segment.target: This option can be configured in the following ways:

segment.source: During the installation of the UE-V agent through a command-line parameter or in a batch script.
segment.target: During the installation of the UE-V agent through a command-line parameter or in a batch script.

segment.source: Using Group Policy.
segment.target: Using Group Policy.

segment.source: After installation, by using PowerShell or WMI.
segment.target: After installation, by using PowerShell or WMI.

segment.source: The path must be in a universal naming convention (UNC) path of the server and share.
segment.target: The path must be in a universal naming convention (UNC) path of the server and share.

segment.source: For example, serversettingsshare.
segment.target: For example, serversettingsshare.

segment.source: This configuration option supports the use of variables to enable specific roaming scenarios.
segment.target: This configuration option supports the use of variables to enable specific roaming scenarios.

segment.source: You can use the variable with the UNC path of the server and share.
segment.target: You can use the variable with the UNC path of the server and share.

segment.source: This will provide the same settings experience on all computers or sessions that a user logs into.
segment.target: This will provide the same settings experience on all computers or sessions that a user logs into.

segment.source: Consider this configuration for the following scenarios:
segment.target: Consider this configuration for the following scenarios:

segment.source: Users in the enterprise have multiple, similarly configured physical computers and each user’s settings should be the same across all computers.
segment.target: Users in the enterprise have multiple, similarly configured physical computers and each user’s settings should be the same across all computers.

segment.source: Users in the enterprise use virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) pools where settings should be retained across each user’s VDI sessions.
segment.target: Users in the enterprise use virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) pools where settings should be retained across each user’s VDI sessions.

segment.source: Users in the enterprise have one physical computer and additionally use a VDI.
segment.target: Users in the enterprise have one physical computer and additionally use a VDI.

segment.source: Each user’s settings experience should be the same whether using the physical computer or VDI session.
segment.target: Each user’s settings experience should be the same whether using the physical computer or VDI session.

segment.source: Multiple enterprise computers are used by multiple users.
segment.target: Multiple enterprise computers are used by multiple users.

segment.source: Each user’s settings experience should be the same across all computers.
segment.target: Each user’s settings experience should be the same across all computers.

segment.source: You can use the %username%%computername% variables with the UNC path of the server and share.
segment.target: You can use the %username%%computername% variables with the UNC path of the server and share.

segment.source: This will preserve the settings experience for each computer.
segment.target: This will preserve the settings experience for each computer.

segment.source: Consider this configuration for the following scenarios:
segment.target: Consider this configuration for the following scenarios:

segment.source: Users in the enterprise have multiple physical computers and you want to preserve the settings experience for each computer.
segment.target: Users in the enterprise have multiple physical computers and you want to preserve the settings experience for each computer.

segment.source: The enterprise computers are used by multiple users.
segment.target: The enterprise computers are used by multiple users.

segment.source: The settings experience should be preserved for each computer that the user logs into.
segment.target: The settings experience should be preserved for each computer that the user logs into.

segment.source: The UE-V agent dynamically creates the user-specific settings storage path based on a UE-V configuration setting and the variables that are defined.
segment.target: The UE-V agent dynamically creates the user-specific settings storage path based on a UE-V configuration setting and the variables that are defined.

segment.source: The UE-V agent dynamically creates a hidden system folder named within each user-specific storage location.
segment.target: The UE-V agent dynamically creates a hidden system folder named within each user-specific storage location.

segment.source: The UE-V agent reads and writes settings to this location as defined by registered UE-V settings location templates.
segment.target: The UE-V agent reads and writes settings to this location as defined by registered UE-V settings location templates.

segment.source: If the settings storage location is the same for a set of managed computers of a user, the applicable UE-V settings are determined by a “Last write wins” rule.
segment.target: If the settings storage location is the same for a set of managed computers of a user, the applicable UE-V settings are determined by a “Last write wins” rule.

segment.source: The agent that runs on one computer reads and writes to the settings location independently of agents that run on other computers.
segment.target: The agent that runs on one computer reads and writes to the settings location independently of agents that run on other computers.

segment.source: The last settings and values written are the settings that are applied when the next agent reads from the settings storage location.
segment.target: The last settings and values written are the settings that are applied when the next agent reads from the settings storage location.

segment.source: For more information, see Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploying the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 1.0.

segment.source: Use Active Directory home directory with UE-V
segment.target: Use Active Directory home directory with UE-V

segment.source: If no settings storage location is configured for UE-V when the agent is deployed, then the user’s Active Directory (AD) home directory is used to store settings location packages.
segment.target: If no settings storage location is configured for UE-V when the agent is deployed, then the user’s Active Directory (AD) home directory is used to store settings location packages.

segment.source: The UE-V agent dynamically creates the settings storage folder below the root of the AD home directory of each user.
segment.target: The UE-V agent dynamically creates the settings storage folder below the root of the AD home directory of each user.

segment.source: The agent only uses the Active Directory home directory if a settings storage location (SettingsStoragePath) is not otherwise defined.
segment.target: The agent only uses the Active Directory home directory if a settings storage location (SettingsStoragePath) is not otherwise defined.

segment.source: Synchronize computer clocks for UE-V settings synchronization
segment.target: Synchronize computer clocks for UE-V settings synchronization

segment.source: Computers that run the UE-V agent to synchronize settings must use a time server.
segment.target: Computers that run the UE-V agent to synchronize settings must use a time server.

segment.source: Time stamps are used to determine if settings need to be synchronized from the settings storage location.
segment.target: Time stamps are used to determine if settings need to be synchronized from the settings storage location.

segment.source: If the computer clock is inaccurate, older settings can overwrite newer settings, or the new settings might not be saved to the settings storage location.
segment.target: If the computer clock is inaccurate, older settings can overwrite newer settings, or the new settings might not be saved to the settings storage location.

segment.source: The use of a time server enables UE-V to maintain a consistent settings experience.
segment.target: The use of a time server enables UE-V to maintain a consistent settings experience.

segment.source: Performance and capacity planning
segment.target: Performance and capacity planning

segment.source: Capacity requirements for UE-V can be determined by use of standard disk capacity and network health monitoring.
segment.target: Capacity requirements for UE-V can be determined by use of standard disk capacity and network health monitoring.

segment.source: UE-V uses a Server Message Block (SMB) share for the storage of settings packages.
segment.target: UE-V uses a Server Message Block (SMB) share for the storage of settings packages.

segment.source: The size of settings packages varies depending on the settings information for a specific application.
segment.target: The size of settings packages varies depending on the settings information for a specific application.

segment.source: While most settings packages are small, the synchronization of potentially large files, such as desktop images, can result in poor performance, particularly on slower networks.
segment.target: While most settings packages are small, the synchronization of potentially large files, such as desktop images, can result in poor performance, particularly on slower networks.

segment.source: To minimize problems with network latency, you should create settings storage locations on the same local networks where the users’ computers reside.
segment.target: To minimize problems with network latency, you should create settings storage locations on the same local networks where the users’ computers reside.

segment.source: By default, the UE-V synchronization will time out after 2 seconds if the network is slow or the settings package is large.
segment.target: By default, the UE-V synchronization will time out after 2 seconds if the network is slow or the settings package is large.

segment.source: You can configure the timeout with Group Policy.
segment.target: You can configure the timeout with Group Policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to set the timeout, see Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: For more information about how to set the timeout, see Configuring UE-V with Group Policy Objects.
